medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr K's tongue pain began in April 2006, worsening over time. He experienced significant pain from radiation therapy, including burns and ulcers, which have all abated after treatment. He mentioned concerns about recovery pain and difficulties controlling oral secretions.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mr K has a long history of precancerous and cancerous oral lesions. He developed a tongue lesion in 1997 which was treated but recurred as squamous cell carcinoma in 1999. He has a history of hypertension, diabetes mellitus, and well-controlled HIV infection. He has undergone multiple surgeries and radiotherapy for his cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Mr K is a financial analyst and does not smoke or consume significant alcohol. He is currently dependent on liquid artificial hydration and nutrition through a gastrostomy tube due to his condition.
